path_1.title: John Mayer: Any Given Thursday (2003)
path_1.feeling: Thrilled to relive Mayer’s early tour energy and guitar chops.

path_1.title: Rocky V (1990)
path_1.feeling: Appreciated the mentor angle, but it doesn’t hit like the original.

path_1.title: One Million Years B.C. (1966)
path_1.feeling: Fun pulp vibes, but the story and style feel thin for me.

path_1.title: Cars (2006)
path_1.feeling: Charming and the racing angle works, even if it’s a lighter Pixar.

path_1.title: Yogi Bear (2010)
path_1.feeling: Simple, harmless fun with a few chuckles.

path_1.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_1.feeling: Sweet and quirky, though the whimsy only half-clicked for me.

path_1.title: Zodiac (2007)
path_1.feeling: Gripping and methodical

path_1.title: Fastball (2016)
path_1.feeling: Interesting look at the sport’s obsession with speed, solid talking heads.

path_1.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
path_1.feeling: Moving performances, but the prestige gloss keeps me at arm’s length.

path_1.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children (2016)
path_1.feeling: Imaginative and moody, a bit uneven but engaging.

path_1.title: Signs (2002)
path_1.feeling: Tight, eerie, and surprisingly heartfelt.

path_1.title: American in Paris, An (1951)
path_1.feeling: Lush music and romance with classic charm.

path_1.title: Vanilla Sky (2001)
path_1.feeling: Dreamy and intriguing, even if it meanders.

path_1.title: Adjustment Bureau, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: Neat fate-versus-free-will hook with a likable romance.

path_1.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_1.feeling: Grand and ambitious, but the heady sci-fi left me a bit cold.

path_1.title: Sliver (1993)
path_1.feeling: Slick and pulpy

path_1.title: Pale Rider (1985)
path_1.feeling: Classic, steady western mood that I enjoy.

path_1.title: Zoolander (2001)
path_1.feeling: Dumb in the best way—quotable and rewatchable.

path_1.title: Man of Steel (2013)
path_1.feeling: Big and brooding, decent but not my favorite superhero tone.

path_1.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_1.feeling: Lesser Bond but still a brisk, engaging ride.

path_1.title: Big Year, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: Gentle and amiable, if slight.

path_1.title: Green Lantern (2011)
path_1.feeling: Concept is cool, execution is clunky.

path_1.title: Singin' in the Rain (1952)
path_1.feeling: Joyful numbers and old Hollywood charm never get old.

path_1.title: Rocker, The (2008)
path_1.feeling: Goofy, music-y fun with enough laughs.

path_1.title: Iron Man 2 (2010)
path_1.feeling: Snappy banter and suits carry a messy plot.

path_1.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
path_1.feeling: Meta and ridiculous in all the right ways.

path_1.title: Adventures in Babysitting (1987)
path_1.feeling: Light, lively ’80s antics that still play.

path_1.title: Hoodwinked! (2005)
path_1.feeling: Clever structure, uneven jokes.

path_1.title: Wreck-It Ralph (2012)
path_1.feeling: Nostalgic, colorful, and heartfelt.

path_1.title: Road Warrior, The (Mad Max 2) (1981)
path_1.feeling: Lean, propulsive action that totally delivers.

path_2.title: John Mayer: Any Given Thursday (2003)
path_2.feeling: Smooth, intimate live set that hits that Mayer groove I love and would spin again.

path_2.title: Rocky V (1990)
path_2.feeling: Love the character, but this chapter feels thin even with the mentor angle.

path_2.title: One Million Years B.C. (1966)
path_2.feeling: More fun as a pulpy time capsule than a gripping adventure, but still a decent throwback.

path_2.title: Cars (2006)
path_2.feeling: Charming small-town detour with fun car-world gags and a satisfying arc.

path_2.title: Yogi Bear (2010)
path_2.feeling: Harmless kiddie fluff that doesn’t offer much beyond a few mild chuckles.

path_2.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_2.feeling: Quirky and tender with lovely craft, just a little emotionally distant for me.

path_2.title: Zodiac (2007)
path_2.feeling: Meticulous, absorbing procedural that quietly tightens the screws.

path_2.title: Fastball (2016)
path_2.feeling: Neat blend of sports lore and science that kept my curiosity piqued.

path_2.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
path_2.feeling: Polished and tender, though a bit safe to really leave a mark.

path_2.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children (2016)
path_2.feeling: Moody, imaginative yarn that makes for a pleasant dark-fantasy escape.

path_2.title: Signs (2002)
path_2.feeling: Patient, eerie build with emotional payoff that still works on me.

path_2.title: American in Paris, An (1951)
path_2.feeling: Elegant, tuneful classic that’s easy to sink into.

path_2.title: Vanilla Sky (2001)
path_2.feeling: Dreamy, disorienting romance-sci-fi that intrigues more than it truly hits home.

path_2.title: Adjustment Bureau, The (2011)
path_2.feeling: Engaging fate-versus-love chase that’s fun even if a bit tidy.

path_2.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_2.feeling: Big-hearted space epic with ideas and emotion that mostly land.

path_2.title: Sliver (1993)
path_2.feeling: Glossy 90s thriller vibes that are watchable but middling.

path_2.title: Pale Rider (1985)
path_2.feeling: Lean, mythic western mood that still rides strong.

path_2.title: Zoolander (2001)
path_2.feeling: Goofy, quotable absurdity that still cracks me up.

path_2.title: Man of Steel (2013)
path_2.feeling: Big and earnest, but the somber tone and noisy finale dull the spark.

path_2.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_2.feeling: Slick and punchy, just thinner and less satisfying than the Bonds around it.

path_2.title: Big Year, The (2011)
path_2.feeling: Gentle, pleasant diversion with more smiles than big laughs.

path_2.title: Green Lantern (2011)
path_2.feeling: CG-heavy and flat, the ring never quite lights up.

path_2.title: Singin' in the Rain (1952)
path_2.feeling: Joyous, witty musical numbers that are hard not to grin through.

path_2.title: Rocker, The (2008)
path_2.feeling: Light, predictable band hijinks buoyed by a few decent gags.

path_2.title: Iron Man 2 (2010)
path_2.feeling: Charismatic bits, but overstuffed and a little scattered.

path_2.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
path_2.feeling: Self-aware, high-energy laughs that land more often than not.

path_2.title: Adventures in Babysitting (1987)
path_2.feeling: A charmingly chaotic 80s night-out romp.

path_2.title: Hoodwinked! (2005)
path_2.feeling: Clever premise, uneven execution, still good for a few laughs.

path_2.title: Wreck-It Ralph (2012)
path_2.feeling: Inventive world-building with a big heart and nostalgia hits.

path_2.title: Road Warrior, The (Mad Max 2) (1981)

path_2.title: Rocky V (1990)
path_2.feeling: Some franchise heart, but the drop in punch and polish left me lukewarm.

path_2.feeling: Tender, offbeat charm and meticulous craft worked on me.

path_2.title: Zodiac (2007)

path_2.title: Fastball (2016)
path_2.feeling: Stat-nerdy speed talk scratched my sports-doc itch.

path_2.feeling: Performances moved me a bit, but the biopic beats felt standard.
